content.description:
These pristine boulders are located in the vicinity of Lower Arrow Lake in Syringa Provincial Park in a beautiful setting with the lake/beach nearby and your campsite a stones throw from the climbing; this is a great basecamp for any visiting climber to the region. 
  
 The climbing is compromised of 5 different boulders all located within walking distance from the Provincial Park campground. The rock here is made up of a very compact type of Granite/Gneiss thatâ€™s very solid and super sticky and a little different from the rest of Arrow Lake. There is a ton of variety that exists between the different boulders; lots of steep, powerful, technical, committing and natural climbing. The problems here stand amongst some of the best @ Arrow Lake, there are some lines here that would be classic anywhere in the world :)
